alert.note: Alert for Cheshire (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 1:20AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern New Hampshire, including the following county, Cheshire. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 119 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain fell earlier tonight due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area due to residual runoff. Between 2.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Keene, Swanzey, Winchester, Richmond, Surry, Gilsum, Roxbury, Sullivan and Westmoreland.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
